 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Vi undanber oss samtal och mejl från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansök via e-post

title: Head Government Affairs and Communications, Sweden
description:
**Site Name:** 
 Solna
   

  

**Posted Date:** 
 Jul 3 2025
   

  

**Head of Government Affairs and Communications, Sweden**
 We have a new opportunity for a Head Government Affairs and Communications in Stockholm.
   

  

 The Head of Government Affairs and Communications will be accountable for delivery of GSK’s communication and government affairs strategies in Sweden. Ensuring GSK is perceived as a trusted partner externally, influencing national policy and managing external affairs matters both on an ongoing and issues management basis. As a member of GSK Sweden’s Lead team, you will be proactively identifying opportunities and addressing challenges across the business to ensure GSK Sweden achieves its ambition.
   

  

**Role responsibilities:**
* Be accountable for ensuring GSK Sweden deploys a single 'One GSK' consistent and integrated story promoted by sustained campaigns employing all elements of internal and external communication.
* Serve as the main liaison between the company and external stakeholders on governmental matters. Represent GSK's agenda and actions amongst key stakeholders (e.g. government, media, political parties, societies, representative organisations, NGOs, IGOs & trade associations).
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key government officials, legislators, and other public stakeholders.
* Drive "listening and analysis" providing early insights on healthcare, social, economic, and political developments of enterprise interest to inform business decisions.
* Coordinate and align with the regional above country CGA teams, sharing country insights and best practice and engaging with local stakeholders to support key regional and corporate policy and business priorities.
* Proactively engage in the health policy debate with various stakeholders internally and externally.
* Advise the Sweden Leadership Team on governmental and public policy issues, providing insights into the political environment and the potential impact on the company’s operations.
* Support senior leadership in crisis management, particularly on regulatory or policy issues that could affect product launches, pricing, or market access.
* Develop and execute public affairs strategies, specific to Oncology and Vaccines to communicate the company’s position on relevant governmental issues.
* Manage media relations and public perception in relation to government policies and regulations that affect the pharmaceutical industry.
* Monitor policy makers, legislative environment and debated changes and act proactively at relevant levels.
* Advise on and develop advocacy plans for GSK on priority policy issues in collaboration with internal multifunctional teams as well as the development of deliverables (e.g. position papers).
* Develop stakeholder mapping with customised advocacy, clear correlation to business priorities, and clear estimates of potential business opportunity.
* Track legislative and regulatory changes in Sweden and across Europe, and report relevant developments to the leadership team.
* Act as a custodian of GSK's brand and reputation. This means proactively identifying risks, opportunities and future trends with a short- and long-term view, sharing these insights and influence decision-making in the company.
* Bring the outside in requires the whole business to think about the reputational and external aspects to all activity. CGA is not simply about managing issues when they arise but ensuring a proactive mindset towards managing GSK's reputation.
* Contribute to the development and execution of product/commercial and wider corporate external communications plans that supports short- and long-term view business objectives and builds Trust externally.
* Understand the media landscape and the importance of newspaper, broadcast and digital reporting can impact GSK's licence to operate and demonstrate agility in how GSK interacts with media and for different purposes.
* Develop and implement strategies to enhance and protect the company's reputation in Sweden, ensuring alignment with corporate values and key messaging across all traditional and online platforms eg LinkedIn.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with Swedish media outlets and journalists to effectively communicate the company's initiatives, news, and responses to industry developments.
* Oversee the creation and delivery of internal communications to engage employees, ensure alignment with corporate objectives, and promote a positive company culture.
* Lead the development and execution of crisis communication strategies, managing any potential reputation risks, and responding to media or public inquiries during critical situations.
* Manage communication with key external stakeholders, including government bodies, and industry partners, ensuring that the company's messaging is clear, consistent, and transparent across all channels.
* Ensure GSK's culture, purpose, strategy, priorities are well communicated and embedded internally with the right support provided to leaders and spokespeople to communicate more autonomously but still effectively.
* Embody a Business First mindset as we seek to drive a cultural change in GSK and support change in the organization with effective communication.
* Where necessary to be prepared to work beyond core role to deliver best results for the organization.
* Role model GSK's culture. Adhere to GSK Code of Ethics, the LIR Code of marketing practice for the pharmaceutical industry and in line with scientific engagement principles.
* Must report safety issues occurring in association with any GSK product in an expeditious manner to the GSK Sweden pharmacovigilance department, in accordance with company SOP.


***Why you?***
 Qualifications & Skills:
   

  

 We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
   

  

  

* Leadership experience in communications, government affairs, public policy, market access or marketing at global or region level.
* 7+ years as Head of CGA, Governmental Affair roles in Pharma, Biotech or Medtech at country, region or global level
* 5+ years experience in either Oncology or Vaccines as commercial, marketing or CGA in country or region/global
* Advanced business judgement and analytical skills.
* Integrated into network of key stakeholders/payer customers in Sweden
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* High personal accountability and integrity combined with the ability and experience to influence at a strategic level and gain the support and commitment of internal and external stakeholders
* Demonstrated track record as a strategic thinker with strong problem-solving skills and creative, solution-focused approach
* Excellent business acumen and demonstrated sustained level of delivery of commercial performance
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to convey a compelling vision and inspire others to help achieve it


**Preferred Qualifications & Skills:**
**If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:**
* Good knowledge of the pharmaceuticals market and GSK's internal operating environment.
* Values-led approach with a track record in delivering through people in teams and across a matrix.
* Leverages stakeholder networks, industry and other working groups to stay informed on current environment, market and customer trends and expected future developments


**Closing Date for Applications – 03 Aug** 
**2025 (COB)**
 Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert. When applying for this role, please use the ‘cover letter’ of the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.
   

  

**Why GSK?**
**Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.**
 GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).
   

  

 Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.
   

  

 If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).
   

  

 GSK is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), military service or any basis prohibited under federal, state or local law.
   

  

**Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies**
 GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
   

  

 Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) website at https://openpaymentsdata.cms.gov/

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

**Your place of employment can be anywhere in Sweden, with visits to the client site.**
 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Please be informed you may be requested to provide DNV with additional documents for a background check.

title: Business Development Representative (BDR)
description:
We founded Legora with a simple thesis. AI is going to fundamentally change how legal work gets done. In 2023, we started as a startup called Leya in the basement of the biggest law firm in the Nordics. Through shared efforts, mutual growth, and true problem-solving, we built a product tailored to the needs of lawyers at the top firms. The spirit from those days remains.
   

  

 As a BDR at Legora, you’ll be on the frontlines of our growth engine: identifying, engaging, and qualifying new business opportunities. You’ll be the critical first touch for prospective clients: turning awareness into conversations, and conversations into qualified pipeline. This is a role for someone who knows how to spark interest, build trust quickly, and thrive in fast, structured outreach.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with Marketing and Sales to ensure nothing promising slips through the cracks - and that our outreach is as smart, relevant, and high-conviction as our product. You’ll report to our Director of Demand Generation and collaborate with GTM leadership to shape the way we scale.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Own outbound prospecting Build and execute targeted outreach across email, LinkedIn, phone, and events — breaking into key accounts and turning cold starts into warm leads.
* Qualify opportunities Run tight discovery calls and needs assessments to evaluate fit against our ideal customer profile. Your job is to connect dots quickly and accurately.
* Nurture leads Keep momentum alive with smart, value-driven follow-up that guides prospects through the early stages of the journey.
* Partner with Sales & Marketing Align with campaign priorities and collaborate closely with Account Executives for smooth handovers and shared wins.
* Keep the pipeline clean Log activity with discipline in Salesforce and enable clear forecasting and reporting.
* Surface market insight Feed back what you hear on the frontlines to help us sharpen messaging, positioning, and targeting.
* Support events & campaigns Engage leads pre- and post-event, helping make sure our campaigns generate real commercial outcomes.


 What You Bring
   

  

* 1–2 years experience in a BDR, SDR, or Sales Associate role, ideally in SaaS, tech, or financial services.
* Familiarity with tools like Salesforce, Apollo, Clay, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.
* Strong communication skills: persuasive, concise, and human - in writing and in speech.
* Highly organized and comfortable managing multiple outreach streams at once.
* A curious, motivated learner with strong instincts for prioritization.
* Resilience and drive: you take feedback well, act fast, and don’t let no slow you down.
* A collaborative mindset - you’re team-first and know how to hand off, sync up, and help others win.


 What We Offer
   

  

* The opportunity to launch your GTM career at a legal AI company with true product–market fit.
* Direct exposure to senior sales leadership and the chance to learn by doing: fast.
* Structured onboarding, regular coaching, and clear paths for growth into AE or Marketing roles.
* A fast-moving environment where your insights shape how we scale.
* Competitive base salary, uncapped variable compensation, and equity upside.
* 30 days of paid time off, flexible working setup, and beautifully designed offices in Stockholm and London.


 Few companies can claim to be changing the way legal work gets done — Legora can. If you want to be part of a high-growth team helping redefine an industry, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Client Manager
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com
   

  

 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**About Mindshare: A Leading WPP Media Brand**
 Mindshare delivers Good Growth for its clients. As “Growth Architects," we drive growth that benefits all stakeholders — better for people, planet, and business — by using media with intention. This approach creates more meaningful connections with consumers, increases consumer trust in the brand, and delivers better outcomes for all stakeholders.
   

  

**Role Summary And Impact**
 We are looking for a collaborative and solution-oriented Client Manager who enjoys working closely with clients and coordinating the delivery of effective communication solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll act as a central contact between clients, media strategists, specialists, and client directors - ensuring a smooth process from brief and planning through to execution, analysis, and optimization.
   

  

 With a solid understanding of both client needs and the evolving media landscape, you bring the right people together to solve operational challenges and help shape forward-thinking media strategies.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
**We believe you might enjoy this role if you…** 
  

  

* Are structured and comfortable managing administrative tasks.
* Have a genuine interest in media and marketing and enjoy continuous learning.
* Work proactively and are solution-focused, with a collaborative mindset.
* Feel energized in fast-paced environments and handle shifting priorities well.
* Build strong working relationships and communicate clearly with different stakeholders.
* Can balance strategic thinking with attention to detail.
* Are comfortable working in an international context.
* Are fluent in Swedish (spoken and written) and confident in English communication.
* Bring a positive, curious attitude and like to contribute with energy and ideas.


**To succeed in this role, we believe you bring…**
* At least four years of experience in media project management or coordination - from agency, media, or client side.
* A strong understanding of digital media, along with experience in other media channels and how they work together.
* Confidence in independently leading and developing projects, and engaging your team effectively.
* Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to adapt your message to different audiences.
* A university degree in economics, marketing, communications or similar.
* Experience in budgeting, reporting, and evaluating project performance.


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year. In Sweden, our benefits include wellness allowance, occupational pension, health insurance, and generous vacation policies. We recognize local public holidays and offer flexible working conditions, including hybrid work models.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a start date as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.
   

  

 In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase. Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.

title: AWS DevSecOps Engineer
description:
They say, ‘it’s not rocket science.’ We disagree.
   

  

 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting
   

  

 services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna,
   

  

 northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?**
**Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?**
 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize this opportunity.
   

  

 At SSC, our systems help launch rockets and control satellites. To do that, we need robust automation, reliable deployments, and a cloud platform that just works . We're looking for an AWS Dev Sec Ops Engineer who thrives on clean pipelines, codified infrastructure, and high uptime.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 As AWS DevSecOps Engineer, you’ll be a builder of automation, an advocate for reliability, and a champion for operational excellence. You’ll work hands-on with AWS and modern DevSecOps tools to streamline how we deploy and manage our systems.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code using Terraform or CloudFormation
* Build CI/CD pipelines for cloud-based systems and applications
* Automate deployment and environment provisioning workflows
* Manage containerized workloads with EKS, ECS, or Fargate
* Monitor systems and respond to operational incidents
* Improve reliability through observability, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with developers and architects on solution design and deployment
* Document infrastructure and processes for internal use and audits
* Quality assurance
* Software supply chain – ECR, JFROG
* Building policy engine and guardrails focus on security
* Application Performance Monitoring “observability”


**Who You Are**
 You are passionate about automation and proud of building reliable systems. You are driven by curiosity and a commitment to continuous improvement, with an automation-first mindset at the core. You also bring a collaborative and service-minded approach, and feel at ease working across both IT and development teams.
   

  

 You are f luent in Swedish and English, ensuring smooth communication in diverse settings.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* 3+ years of hands-on AWS experience in production environments
* Solid skills in infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation)
* Experience building CI/CD pipelines (e.g. GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline, Jenkins)
* Familiarity with container orchestration and Linux system administration
* Knowledge of monitoring and logging solutions in AWS (e.g. CloudWatch, OpenTelemetry)


**We Value Experience With**
* Experience with Ansible or similar config management tools
* Scripting skills (Python, Bash)
* Exposure to DevSecOps practices


**WE OFFER YOU**
* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


**Additional Benefits**
* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligeble employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


**LOCATION**
 This is permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at  our office in Solna Strand.
   

  

**FURTHER INFORMATION**
 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

**Sveriges Ingenjörer** 
 : SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

**Unionen** 
 : unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: MAX are looking for new co-workers!
description:
*MAX is not only Sweden’s favourite burger restaurant chain, it is also one of the first. Back in 1968 the founders of MAX, Curt Bergfors and Britta Andersson, opened their first restaurant in Gällivare, high up in the northern parts of Sweden. Today we are more than 5000 employees in several countries and we are constantly growing.*
 Aiming for a career within the fast food business? Looking for additional income during your studies? Either way we might have the right opportunity for you!
   

  

 All people are equal! To us that means equal opportunities, rights and obligations no matter who you are. The only limit is your own goals and results. We will guide you through with a clear plan, internal training and great opportunities to grow and develop with Sweden’s tastiest burger chain.
   

  

 Your job at the restaurant will include to serve our guests, prepare the food and make sure the restaurant is clean and tidy at all times. The main goal is to provide Sweden’s tastiest burgers, every day. The working hours will vary from daytime, evenings to nights and weekends. To make sure you get familiar with all aspects of the job you will be guided by your manager through digital and on-the-job training. Almost all of our managers have started their career in this very position.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 In order to fancy this job you need to love service and enjoy fast pace. You like to work in a team and are most effective when you get to be a part of a group. Quality is key to us so you need to be very orderly but at the same time keep up with the guest’s expectations on fast delivery.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A fast paced fun job where everyone works closely together as well as great opportunities to grow and develop along with us. Terms and conditions are according to our collective agreement and we also offer health benefits to all employees.
   

  

 We welcome your application as soon as possible! Please note that the selection process will start immediately and that the position might be filled before the application deadline.
