title: Tech lead - Healthcare
company_industry: Software Development, Hospitals and Health Care, and Public Health
description:
Tech Lead / Lead software engineer - HealthTech - Stockholm 🏥👩 ⚕️
 



  





  





 I'm working in partnership with one of Stockholm's most exciting & innovative product companies, developing a cutting-edge platform which leverages complex AI & ML, a robust Cloud infrastructure and pixel-perfect web applications to deliver a comprehensive & meaningful product for Healthcare professionals and patients alike!
 



  





 Having scaled organically with a focus on bringing in super talented developers & engineers whilst retaining a warm, collaborative and ego-free culture, as-well as finding a solid product-market fit and accruing thousands of customers, they are in a fantastic position to grow the team in Stockholm, with plenty of new developments & innovation in the works, and further leveraging LLMs and GenAI tools to automate and optimize workflows!
 



  





 With this in mind, they are looking for a senior software engineer who would be interested in taking on the role of lead engineer!
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Design, develop and continually optimize robust & scalable backend systems using Typescript, NodeJS
* Work in a fluid and open environment where you can be hands on with the wider stack, building & maintaining AWS Cloud infrastructure.
* Develop and support software including applications, database integration, interfaces, and new functionality enhancements
* As lead engineer, you will play a key part in the mentoring and growth of a team of talented engineers, own the technical roadmap and play a key role in defining the architecture in close collaboration with the Engineering and product management
* Work as part of a genuinely passionate, collaborative & driven cross-functional team, in a space where everyone is encouraged to experiment and bring their own ideas to the table!
* Participate in code reviews



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* 6+ Years of professional experience with Typescript/Javascript; NodeJS, MongoDB, React, NestJS, GraphQL
* 2+ Years in a leadership capacity; either as a technical lead, mentor, or hands-on engineering manager
* 3+ Years within AWS Cloud
* Ideally you have some experience with IaaC; Terraform/CDK
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, Docker containers & Kubernetes clusters



  





 This role would require current residency in Sweden, (we are based in Stockholm and operate on a hybrid model), and they would not be able to support with Visa support at this time

title: Solution Architect
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
**Join Scania's IT Transformation Journey**
 Scania is embarking on an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of comprehensive sustainable transport solutions. We are seeking a talented and passionate Solution Architect to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in this transformation.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Solution Architect, you’ll be at the heart of our global system landscape—connecting the dots between business needs and technical solutions. You’ll influence strategic decisions, modernise legacy systems, and design innovative solutions that power our operations worldwide.
   

  

 What We Expect
   

  

 We are looking for someone who thrives on collaboration and communication since you will work closely with stakeholders, developers, and users, as well as the broader architect community. Understanding strategic direction, business requirements and processes is essential, with a focus on structuring IT solutions.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 What you will do
   

  

  

* Drive some of the most high-impact initiatives within Scania and TRATON Logistics.
* Shape global IT solutions that align with business goals and market trends.
* Translate complex requirements into clear, structured IT architectures.
* Use modelling tools and frameworks to communicate your vision effectively.
* Collaborate across all levels—from developers to senior stakeholders—to ensure alignment and clarity.
* Champion long-term thinking while delivering practical, scalable solutions.
* Challenge the status quo and help us work smarter, not harder.


**Who You Are**
 You’re a natural collaborator with a strategic mindset and a passion for technology. You bring:
   

  

  

* Proven experience in architectural roles within global organisations.
* An agile mindset and a proactive, solution-oriented approach.
* Broad technical skills preferably within IT—ideally with a background in system development or analysis.
* Deep understanding of modern architecture, integration technologies, and secure development practices.
* Knowledge of the logistics domain and how IT can drive operational excellence.
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken).
* Bonus: Experience with cloud-based solutions.


**This Is Us**
 You’ll join a diverse and agile team of project managers, architects, developers, and service managers. We value open dialogue, shared ownership, and continuous learning. With strong support from our offshore delivery team, we’re scaling up to meet tomorrow’s challenges—together.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-15. Screening will take place mainly after the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 group manager Jessica Fjällkeborn, jessica.fjallkeborn@scania.com
   

  

 Please note that due to the summer vacation period, responses to questions may take longer than usual, and interviews will be scheduled after the holidays
 **.**
**We look forward for your application!**

title: Customer Success Executive
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The
 **Customer Success Executive** 
 is responsible for providing strategic leadership and driving the execution of post-sales activities across our most strategic accounts in Sweden. This position plays a crucial role in driving ServiceNow’s long-term value by accelerating customers’ journey to success, ensuring predictable renewals, and maximizing the impact of ServiceNow across their business transformation initiatives.
   

  

 As a trusted advisor, you’ll partner with C-level executives, guide seamless delivery of business transformation, and foster collaboration with ServiceNow’s teams and strategic partners.
   

  

**What You Get To Do In This Role**
* Drive Post-Sales Success: Own and lead the customer’s post-sales transformation, aligning ServiceNow’s offerings to customer goals, and bringing relevant industry thought-leadership to the table. Foster strong relationships with C-Level executives to deliver on business outcomes.
* Collaborate Strategically: Partner with Account Executives to create and execute integrated pre- and post-sales strategies, delivering long-term value for both the customer and ServiceNow. Leverage the right resources at the right time to ensure success.
* Mitigate Risks and Drive Value: Proactively identify potential risks to success and work with the customer and internal teams to develop strategies to overcome them, ensuring a smooth path toward value realization.
* Focus on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): Guide and inspire the Customer Success team to meet critical operational KPIs—adoption, technical health, renewals, customer satisfaction, and expansion. Work closely with customers to align their roadmap and drive new revenue opportunities.
* Foster Strategic Alignment: Build relationships with ServiceNow leaders and consistently incorporate customer feedback to drive continuous improvement. Align business transformation insights with organizational goals to ensure long-term success.
* Advocate for Innovation and Continuous Learning: As a strategic thought leader, drive innovative solutions for our customers, always looking for opportunities to help them achieve their long-term goals. Foster a culture of agility and calculated risk-taking within the team.
* Set Success Metrics and Milestones: Establish clear, measurable success metrics with the customer, and regularly review progress. Refine business transformation plans as needed to ensure milestones are met and value is realized


**Qualifications**
 We are seeking a highly experienced professional with a strong background in
 **enterprise-level SaaS transformation and strategic advisory** 
 to guide our customers in their digital transformation journey. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in technology-enabled business transformations, coupled with a proven ability to advise at the executive level.
   

  

**Key Requirements**
* AI Integration & Thought Leadership: Experience leveraging AI to enhance work processes, decision-making, and problem-solving, including AI-powered automation, workflow optimization, and data-driven insights
* Enterprise SaaS Transformation & Strategic Advisory: Extensive experience leading large-scale digital transformations within SaaS or enterprise software environments.
* C-Level Presence & Relationship Management: Proven ability to engage, influence, and build lasting relationships with senior executives, including within some of the world’s largest enterprises..
* Leadership Expertise: A minimum of 15 years in management consulting, solution consulting, or a leadership role at a top-tier consulting firm, with a strong track record of exceeding business objectives.
* Strategic Account Management: Demonstrated success in leading high-impact customer success or consulting teams and managing complex, strategic accounts.
* Business Acumen & Problem-Solving: Ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex business challenges while aligning technology solutions with customer objectives.
* Cross-Functional Leadership: Strong experience working across multiple departments, driving alignment, and managing stakeholders in large, matrixed organizations.
* Adaptability & Change Management: Ability to navigate dynamic environments, adjusting strategies to meet evolving customer and business needs.
* Operational & Execution Excellence: Skilled at designing and implementing scalable, repeatable processes while maintaining a hands-on approach to drive successful execution.
* Collaboration & Communication: Exceptional ability to communicate complex ideas clearly, foster collaboration across teams, and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Customer-Centric Mindset: Deep understanding of customer challenges, needs, and motivations, with a focus on delivering value-driven solutions and ensuring long-term success.
* Fluency in English and Swedish is essential
* Right to work in Sweden


 This role is ideal for a
 **seasoned strategic advisor** 
 who thrives in high-impact environments and has the expertise to guide enterprise customers through digital transformation at scale.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We lead with flexibility and trust in our distributed world of work. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
**IT Solution Architect**
*Are you seeking a key role where you can influence the future IT architecture of world-leading command and control software solutions? Are you motivated by the opportunity to apply your technical leadership skills and leverage your experience in software architecture, design, and implementation?*
**Join Systematic Sweden**
 Systematic is a fast-growing and innovative software company with customers in over 50 countries worldwide. Our mission is to develop software products that support users in making tactical decisions in critical situations. Our C4I software suite, SitaWare, is an interoperable digital command and control information system that delivers situational awareness at all levels of command. We are proud to say that the SitaWare Suite is the most widely used C4I suite globally.
   

  

 You will be part of our Defence Services organisation, joining a specialist unit focused on implementing our Command & Control solutions across the Nordics. The role is based in our Stockholm office, reporting to the Senior Project Manager for the Nordic constellation.
   

  

**Technical Leadership with a Customer-Facing Role**
 As an IT Architect, you will play a key role in delivering our SitaWare and IRIS software suites to Defence customers in Sweden. You will work closely with our product development teams in Denmark and our Swedish customer, deploying mission-critical systems that simplify decision-making. Your tasks will span solution design, configuration, installation, technical support, training, interoperability, development, and testing.
   

  

 As a Solution Architect, your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Taking technical ownership in the design, implementation, and support of solutions
* Ensuring projects are delivered within agreed scope and timelines
* Supporting training for system administrators and end-users
* Coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, subcontractors, consultants, and colleagues
* Contributing to pre-sales activities and proposal writing
* Staying informed about Systematic’s product status to align customer expectations with the product roadmap and maximise value for both customers and our portfolio


 Some light travel across Northern Europe may be required.
   

  

**Our new colleague**
 ….. has strong and broad IT technical skills, combined with several years of experience in a similar role. To thrive in this position, you must be self-driven, with strong leadership skills and the ability to coach and motivate others.We are looking for a natural team player with a collaborative, knowledge-sharing approach and the ability to build strong professional relationships.
   

  

 Ideally, you:
   

  

* Enjoy customer-facing activities such as technical support and presentations, and you build trust easily
* Hold a relevant technical degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s level)
* Are a strong communicator in both Swedish and English
* Thrive in an agile and dynamic work environment
* You likely have experience in one or more of the following areas:


 Furthermore, you probably have experience within some or all of the following:
   

 tactical communications systems, software development, IT infrastructure, software and system testing and/or test management (e.g. ISTQB), technical training, external customer-facing projects and delivering services and consultancy in the IT sector.
   

  

 It would also be an advantage if you have a military background from an IT-related role in the Swedish armed forces.
   

  

 Because we work with security-classified projects, all Systematic Defence employees must have a security clearance or be eligible to apply for one. Learn more at http:
   

 //systematic.com/clearance.
   

  

**Welcome to Systematic Stockholm**
 Join our cheerful and dynamic Stockholm office, where every day is filled with excitement and camaraderie. Located in the heart of the city, our office offers easy access and a plethora of lunch options in the nearby area. Experience the thrill of working in an international environment where customer satisfaction is our driving force.
   

  

**Never stop developing**
 Systematic is uniquely people-centric, truly international and proudly rooted in Denmark with more than 1100 employees. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.
   

  

**Start your development here**
 We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Stine Aulby Mather, Senior Project Manager.
   

  

***Please be aware that response times may be longer due to summer holidays.***
 Get in touch
   

  

 Sofie Heiner Emborg
   

  

 Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

title: Test Automation Engineer – Cloud Data Warehouse
description:
**Uppdragsöversikt:**
 Vi söker en erfaren och tekniskt stark testautomationsingenjör för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i deras nya, molnbaserade datalagerplattform (YoDA), byggd på Azure och Snowflake.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta som en del av agila utvecklingsteam inom ett SAFe®-releaseteam och bidra till förbättring, design och exekvering av automatiserade teststrategier med hjälp av verktyg som X-Automate (XAM) och Robot Framework. De primära testmålen implementeras i ADE.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden:**
* Designa och genomföra automatiserade testfall
* Ständigt förbättra teststrategier och ramverk
* Implementera prioriterade förbättringar i linje med SAFe®-metoder
* Stödja kunskapsöverföring till interna team
* Testa strukturerade och filbaserade dataflöden (t.ex. import/export till DWH)


**Nödvändiga färdigheter:**
* Avancerad erfarenhet av SQL-testning
* Testautomation i analysplattformar / datalager
* Praktisk erfarenhet av testramverk som Robot Framework
* Kunskaper i både svenska och engelska (skrift och muntlig)
* ISTQB Foundation-certifiering


**Bra att ha-färdigheter:**
* Erfarenhet av Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake
* Kännedom om SAFe®-metodik
* Testning av system inom försäkring eller finans
* Erfarenhet av att använda Azure DevOps
* Skript med Python
* ISTQB Advanced Test Analyst eller liknande certifiering


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Strukturerad och analytisk
* Pragmatisk och motståndskraftig under press
* Stark samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga
* Villighet att dela kunskap och stödja kompetensuppbyggnad

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Role:** 
 AI Engineer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Hybrid) or Remote within the Nordic region
 



**Job Type:** 
 Permanent, Full-time
 



**Salary:** 
 Dependent on experience
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 We’re working with a fast-growing, VC-backed Fintech company on a mission to transform how modern finance teams operate. Following a recent $16M funding round, they’re scaling an AI-powered platform designed to radically simplify workflows for accountants and finance professionals. At the heart of their product is intelligent automation, redefining back-office operations through seamless technology.
 



 They’re now looking for an AI Engineer to join the team and help build smart, intuitive features that bring automation and intelligence to complex, manual workflows, delivering production-ready software that scales with real-world use.
 



  





  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 




 As an AI Engineer, you’ll work at the intersection of AI innovation and real-world application. Collaborating closely with engineers, designers, and product managers, you’ll design and deploy intelligent systems that drive measurable efficiency. In this role, you will:
 


* Designing and implementing intelligent automation workflows across tax, finance, and compliance domains.
* Building scalable knowledge systems for storing, retrieving, and reasoning over complex information.
* Managing end-to-end AI pipelines, including prompts, vector databases, fine-tuned models, and evaluation frameworks.
* Developing deep product and domain expertise to anticipate user needs and shape smarter solutions.



  





  





  





  





  





**What They’re Looking For** 




 They’re after someone who’s not just technically excellent, but curious, creative, and excited by complexity. Ideally, you bring:
 



  




* 3+ years of hands-on commercial experience building AI-driven products in a product-based organisation (not a consultancy or academic setting).
* Deep understanding of large language models at a foundational level - not just surface-level familiarity.
* Background in Software Engineering or Data Science, with a strong foundation in writing production-quality code and solving real-world problems.
* Strong Python skills with experience building or fine-tuning LLMs, managing model pipelines, and deploying solutions in production using modern cloud infrastructure (GCP or Azure)
* Solid grasp of embeddings, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), structured retrieval, and production-grade inference.



  





  





**Bonus Points For:** 



* Bonus points for contributing to or building internal tools for model evaluation and debugging.
* Experience with Typescript



  





  





**Why Join?** 



* Join an early stage company backed by top-tier investors and growing fast.
* Work on a product that directly impacts how thousands of professionals work.
* Collaborate with a team of ambitious, low-ego engineers, designers, and operators.
* Competitive salary and equity.
* Hybrid working model

title: Praktik för affärsutveckling
description:
**Startdatum:** 
 Omgående 
 



**Längd:** 
 6 månader 
 



  





 Är du en självgående person med intresse för marknadsföring och teknologi? Tycker du om att skapa engagerande content, driva kampanjer och prata teknologi med självförtroende?
 



  





 Digisource Consulting AB söker drivna och motiverade praktikanter till vårt dynamiska sälj- och marknadsföringsteam!
 



  





**Vad du får:** 




  




* Direkt inblick i B2B-försäljning och marknadsföring inom IT-branschen



  




* Praktisk erfarenhet av molnbaserade lösningar och gen AI



  




* Möjlighet att arbeta med vårt erfarna team och lära dig hur man driver leadgenerering, prospektering och digitala marknadsföringskampanjer



  




* En flexibel, samarbetsinriktad arbetskultur som uppmuntrar kreativitet och eget ansvar



  




* Chansen att jobba med ett företag som är Amazon (AWS), Google, HubSpot, HiBob, BambooHR Partner



  




* Tidigare praktikanter har beskrivit sin tid hos oss som "berikande och spännande"



  





**Vad vi söker:** 




  




* Intresse och grundläggande förståelse för molnteknologi och Gen AI



  




* Goda färdigheter inom marknadsföring via sociala medier (LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter m.fl.)



  




* Flytande svenska och Enleska (både skriftligt och muntligt) är ett krav



  




* Utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor – du bör vara smart och självsäker i både skrift och tal



  




* Självdrivna personer som är proaktiva, kreativa och lösningsorienterade



  




* Studenter eller nyutexaminerade inom Business, Marketing, IT eller närliggande områden



  





**OBS:** 




  





 Den här praktiken är inte betald, men erbjuder ovärderlig inlärning, mentorskap och insyn i en snabbväxande konsultmiljö. Praktikanter med enastående prestationer kan komma i fråga för framtida roller eller rekommendationer inom vårt nätverk.
 



  





**Om Digisource Consulting AB:** 




  





 ​Digisource Consulting AB är ett ungt och innovationsdrivet företag för digitala lösningar och konsulttjänster baserat i Stockholm. Vårt mål är att utnyttja kraften i digitala teknologier för att transformera och förbättra hur företag fungerar, uppnår strategiska mål och levererar större värde till sina kunder. Vi strävar efter att skapa nya affärsmodeller, bättre servicenivåer, högre konkurrenskraft, ökad intern samverkan, optimerade processer, ökad effektivitet och förbättrad medarbetarprestation.
 



  





 Våra strategiska konsulttjänster är utformade för att driva organisations mot sina mål inom områden som Generativ AI, Cloud, Mobilitet, Supply Chain, Customer Relationship Management, Human Resource Management och e-handel. 
 



  





 För mer information, besök vår hemsida: https://www.digisourceconsulting.com/

title: Risk & Opportunity Manager till PU Fighter EW
job_function: Business Development, General Business, and Management
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*
**Din roll**
 Vi befinner oss i en stark tillväxtfas och söker nu en engagerad och driven Risk & Opportunity Manager som vill vara med och stärka vår projekt- och programverksamhet.
   

  

 I denna roll ansvarar du för att både driva och stötta risk- och möjlighetsarbetet inom Product Unit Fighter EW, både större och mindre projekt. Du arbetar nära projektledare och andra nyckelpersoner för att säkerställa ett proaktivt och affärsnära arbetssätt. Vi söker dig som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för området, där du även bidrar till att utveckla vår kompetens, våra arbetssätt och metoder inom risk- och möjlighetsstyrning.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att variera beroende på projektens faser, men i rollen ingår bland annat att:
   

  

* Upprätta riskhanteringsplaner för projekt
* Stötta och leda projektteam i det operativa risk- och möjlighetsarbetet, inklusive att hålla workshops
* Aktivt bidra till riskidentifiering, klassificering och konsekvensbedömning samt ta fram åtgärds- och handlingsplaner, inklusive bedömning av ekonomisk påverkan
* Följa upp samt rapportera riskarbetet och status för åtgärdsplaner
* Driva det övergripande risk- och möjlighetsarbetet inom Product Unit Fighter EW
* Medverka i utvecklingen av metoder och processer inom riskhantering
* Vid behov genomföra internutbildningar inom området


 Utifrån din profil kan också annat arbete inom sektionen vara aktuellt.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är driven, engagerad och trivs med att vara delaktig i flera olika sammanhang. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med både projektorganisationer och linjefunktioner, vilket ställer krav på din samarbetsförmåga, din kommunikativa skicklighet och din förmåga att bygga goda relationer.
   

  

 Du arbetar strukturerat och metodiskt, samtidigt som du har en stark genomförandekraft och förmåga att driva aktiviteter i mål. Du är bekväm med att leda möten och workshops och har lätt för att uttrycka dig tydligt, både muntligt och skriftligt, på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har en bakgrund som projektledare, gärna inom teknikintensiva verksamheter. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av risk- och/eller möjlighetsarbete är det meriterande, likaså om du har haft en liknande roll tidigare. Vi ser med fördel att du har en ingenjörsutbildning eller annan relevant akademisk bakgrund. Viktigast är dock att du har ett genuint intresse för att vidareutvecklas inom området.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25 500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

**Observera att urvalsarbetet för denna rekrytering startar under vecka 33.**

title: Manager, Technology Regulatory Resilience
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Manager, Technology Regulatory Resilience
   

  

 Manager, Technology Regulatory Resilience (Product Management - Technical)
   

  

**Overview**
 As a Technology Regulatory Resilience Manager within Mastercard’s Technology Regulatory Execution (T-Rex) team, you will help deliver Mastercard's European regulatory resilience agenda. This role is pivotal in aligning Mastercard’s infrastructure, operations, and product capabilities with regulatory expectations around resilience, availability, and security - particularly in the card payments ecosystem.
   

  

 You will collaborate across Technology, Product, Regulatory, Public Policy, and Operations teams to identify and mitigate risks, drive execution of resilience programs, and contribute to regulatory engagements. The role blends technical acumen with regulatory fluency, requiring the ability to analyse risks, shape execution plans, and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

 Role/Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Partner with Technology Regulatory Market Leads, Product teams, and Public Policy to execute Mastercard’s regulatory resilience roadmap for Europe.
* Drive regulatory gap assessments and resilience risk reviews across Mastercard’s European technology estate, especially for in-market (edge) infrastructure.
* Collaborate with engineering, SPM (Strategic Program Management), and platform teams to deliver targeted resilience and risk remediation workstreams.
* Support technical briefings and regulatory engagements with European authorities, offering insights on Mastercard’s resilience posture and architecture.
* Analyze compliance against frameworks like DORA, PSD3, and local central bank mandates to ensure alignment across the tech stack.
* Lead and coordinate cross-functional teams to resolve resilience vulnerabilities and improve performance metrics.
* Contribute to resilience incident reviews, reporting processes, and prevention initiatives to strengthen Mastercard’s proactive risk management.
* Build strong relationships across geographically distributed teams and regulatory stakeholders.


**All About You/Experience**
* Around 10 years of experience in technology with exposure to resilience, compliance or risk or within card payments, fintech or financial services.
* Technical literacy across modern infrastructure (cloud, APIs, real-time payments, network topology) and payments concepts like Open Banking, Card payments, and Real Time Payments.
* Demonstrated understanding of operational resilience concepts: RTO, RPO, SLOs, incident recovery, failover, etc.
* Familiarity with European regulations like DORA, PSD3, EBA/ECB guidance, SIPS and systemic risk principles.
* Experience conducting gap analyses or risk assessments in complex, regulated tech environments.
* Ability to communicate complex technical and regulatory topics with clarity and confidence, both in writing and in person.
* Collaborative, proactive, and accountable with a high level of ownership and curiosity.
* Experience in a consultancy or technology regulatory advisory capacity is a strong plus.
* A strong believer in “resilience by design” and prevention-first engineering principles.


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Workday Systems Analyst
description:
🚀 Ready to Shape the Future of Workday at Pax8?
   

  

**Join us as our next Workday Systems Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden!**
 At Pax8, we’re not just transforming the cloud — we’re redefining how people experience work. As our new
 **Workday Systems Analyst** 
 , you’ll play a key role in shaping our global employee experience through
 **Workday** 
 . If you’re passionate about people, process, and platforms — this is your moment.
   

  

 We’ve just launched Workday — and we need your
 **Time & Attendance** 
 expertise to help us hit the ground running. You’ll be our go-to expert, guiding us through implementation, optimisation, and innovation.
   

  

 ☁️ About Pax8
   

  

 Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and SMBs through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers businesses to grow and stay secure.
   

  

 We’re committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale — and we believe exceptional employee experience inspires exceptional customer experience.
   

  

* 🏆 UK’s Best Companies: Ranked #50.
* 📍 https://www.pax8.com/blog/office-opening-bristol/
* 💡 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/careers/
* 🎥 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-IO3JTx-Dlo
* 🌍 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/ | https://www.pax8.com/en-eu/


 🎯 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

 🔧 System Support & Troubleshooting
   

  

* Be the first-line fixer for HCM queries and access issues.
* Manage user access and support tickets.
* Troubleshoot, test, and optimise Workday modules.


 📊 Data & Documentation
   

  

* Run audits and resolve data discrepancies.
* Maintain clear SOPs and system documentation.


 📚 Training & Enablement
   

  

* Lead engaging training sessions and workshops.
* Empower teams to get the most from Workday.


 🚀 Innovation & Compliance
   

  

* Own release updates and testing.
* Ensure compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other regulations.


 🧠 What You’ll Need to Succeed
   

  

* Experience with People Systems/HRIS, especially Workday.
* Hands-on expertise in Time and Attendance, plus at least four other modules (e.g. Core HCM, Benefits, Learning, Recruiting).
* Bonus points for Workday implementation experience or Workday Pro Certifications.
* Strong Excel and Microsoft Office skills.
* A problem-solving mindset and a passion for people and process.
* A collaborative, self-starting attitude in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to handle sensitive data with care and confidentiality.


 💰 Salary & Benefits
   

  

* Salary: 425,000 - 530,000 SEK ( dependent on experience )
* Long term Incentive Plan (Stock Options after qualified period)
* Dedicated time for training and personal development
* Health & Wellbeing coaching support
* Regular trips to our European offices
* Social and community events


 📍 Office & Working Pattern
   

  

* Hybrid & Home Office Working: 1–2 days in office for collaboration
* Designated Office: Stockholm


 🤝 How to Apply
   

  

 We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet 100% of the criteria — we value diverse perspectives and potential.
   

  

 Need flexibility? We’re happy to accommodate early/late interviews.
   

  

 Have questions? Contact our Talent Partner
 **Harry Jones** 
 on
 **+44 117 457 7243** 
 (No agencies please).
   

  

 🔐 Pre-Employment Checks
   

  

 All successful candidates will undergo ID verification, reference checks, and qualification validation. UK candidates will also complete criminal and financial checks via our third-party provider, Vero. You’ll receive a copy of all checks for your records.
   

  

 🌈 Equal Opportunities
   

  

 Pax8 is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome individuals with the right to work in the UK and are committed to GDPR-compliant data handling throughout our recruitment process.
   

  

 📄 https://www.pax8.com/en-us/terms/job-applicant-privacy-notice/

title: Testautomatiseringsingenjör Helsingborg
description:
Sweden Helsingborg | Apply Before September 30, 2025
**JOB AD | Testautomatiseringsingenjör Helsingborg**
====================================================

*Känner du att testutveckling och test är bortprioriterat på ditt bolag? Upplever du att din kompetensutveckling oftast glöms bort? Känner du dig som en i mängden på ditt stora bolag? Ifall du svarade ja på någon av dessa frågor så är vi övertygade om att System Verification kan vara en perfekt match för dig!*
**VAD VI KAN ERBJUDA DIG**
--------------------------



System Verification brinner för software quality och det genomsyrar allt vi gör. Det är inte bara en del av jobbet, utan det är en kultur och en livsstil på företaget.



Hos oss på System Verification har du fantastiska möjligheterna till professionell utveckling, inklusive tillgång till ett stort nätverk av QA-specialister och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling. Vi tillhandahåller en rad olika externa och interna utbildningar som ger dig goda kunskaper att fortsätta växa testutvecklare.



När vi anställer fyller vi inte bara en position; vi välkomnar en ny medlem till vårt team. Om båda parter känner att det är en bra matchning är vi övertygade om att vi kan hitta spännande uppdrag i linje med din utvecklingsplan.



OM DIG:


* Du har flera års erfarenhet av testautomatisering, med en framgångsrik historia av att underhålla testautomatiseringsramverk i projekt.
* Du är skicklig i vanliga programmeringsspråk som C#, Java, JavaScript, Python eller Ruby.
* Du har arbetat med olika testautomatiseringsverktyg som Selenium, Ranorex eller Cypress, tillsammans med någon form av CI/CD-lösning.
* Du behärskar engelska flytande och kan kommunicera både skriftligt och muntligt. Behärskning av svenska är av fördel.

  



”Even though I've been working alone on some of my assignments I have always felt supported by System Verification, whether it's through the feedback and tips from colleagues or the continuous opportunities for skills development.”  

  

**– Rafal Lutczyk**, Test Automation Engineer at System Verification

  


**OM BOLAGET:**
---------------



En passion för kvalitetssäkring, en entreprenöriell anda och ett stort hjärta när det kommer till varandra – det är en bra beskrivning av vilka vi är och vad som betyder något för oss på System Verification. Det är också anledningen till att så många av våra anställda har stannat hos oss i över 10 år.



Kvalitet finns i vårt DNA, det är vad vi gör och vad vi som företag erbjuder på marknaden – det är så vi förbättrar det digitala livet för våra kunder. Det är en mentalitet och en iver att alltid utvecklas, förändras och prova nya sätt för ett ännu bättre resultat och upplevelse. Men kvalitet behövs och är viktigt i alla aspekter av livet.



Livets pussel är ofta en vardaglig kamp, och vårt mål är att vara arbetsgivaren som passar dig var du än är i ditt liv och karriär. Vi vill att du ska kunna prioritera det som ger dig energi och motivation och tillsammans skapa en arbetsbalans som passar dig. Med oss får du en trygg anställning med stora möjligheter att utveckla din professionella karriär tillsammans med norra Europas största nätverk av QA-specialister. Men du kommer också ha väldigtroligt längs vägen och tid för dina andra passioner förutom QA!



We **care**, we **co-create** and we **elevate**



for **Quality** Assurance in every aspect of life.

  


**ANSÖKAN**
-----------



Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Ta steget mot en spännande karriär hos oss och skicka in din ansökan redan idag! We’ll be waiting…

title: Field Engineering Manager
description:
**Job Overview:**

The Field Engineering Manager is responsible for interpreting internal or external business issues and recommending resolutions. They will be tasked with solving complex project engineering-related problems and will work independently with minimal guidance. The Field Engineering Manager is responsible for leading a functional site engineering team and is regarded as a specialist in the area of field engineering. As such, they must have in-depth expertise in project engineering as well as broad knowledge of the project engineering disciplines within the engineering function


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Manage the field engineering scope of a McDermott project at the construction site in Boden, Sweden.
* Manage and lead a cohesive team of 15-20 discipline field engineers
* Work together with Construction Management and site Superintendents to follow the progress of the work.
* Interact with Home Office Engineering Management, Lead Engineers and Subcontractors, and ensure timely engineering IFC/AFC deliverables.
* Review the Level 3 schedule in advance to be ready with the necessary information to maintain the work progress.
* Support the Quality Field Manager to identify the requirement from engineering in the ITP (Inspection Test Plan).
* Review, evaluate and approve/reject any intended changes and modifications by subcontractors, interact with Home Office when needed
* Manage the technical execution to support the business considerations established for the project.
* Practice and promote Safety in designs and work processes.
* Provide direction to and coordinate with the Engineering and Design Leads on an assigned project.
* Develop and implement the Field Engineering Execution Plan.
	+ Incorporate field engineering execution as appropriate.
	+ Develop internal / external Division of Responsibility (DOR) matrix as required.
	+ Prepare a Field Engineering Coordination Procedure.
* Set-up system to maintain and archive As-Built Redlines of IFC deliverables
* Communicate project requirements to the team.
* Supervise and provide guidance to discipline Field Engineers and construction team members.
* Ensure effective communication among field engineering disciplines.
	+ Document discussions and decisions related to the design.
	+ Prepare, review, and approve meeting minutes.
	+ Timely prepare, review, and approve Technical Queries and design Deviations.
	+ Timely prepare, review, and approve responses to RFI’s and other correspondence.
	+ Timely input to NCR’s raised
	+ Prepare and approve weekly and monthly reports for management.
* Assume responsibility for cost, schedule, quantity, and budget control.
* Manage change effectively and proactively.
* Review work with clients, management, construction and project leads.
* Coordinate third-party interfaces.
* Identify problems and coordinate with the field engineering team to correct.
* Take pro-active approach in identifying potential problems
* Lead orderly handover and archiving of the completed project.
	+ Approve and submit the closeout report.
	+ Review and approve Lessons Learned submitted.
* Review and provide input to McDermott work processes and procedures as requested.
* Celebrate successes with the team

Reports to:
  

Project: Project Engineering Manager, Project Manager, Construction Manager
  

Liaise With: Discipline Field Engineers, P roject Engineer, PEM, PM, Discipline Lead Engineers, Eng Dept Managers, Construction / Fabrication team, Precommissioning and Completions team, Project Controls, Accounting
  

Supervises: Field Engineering team


  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in Engineering.
* Ten-Fifteen (10-15) years of Project Engineering experience.
* Requires depth and / or breadth of expertise in own specialized discipline or field.
* Field assignment experience, preferably in steel mill projects.
* Experience in International Projects.
* Experience in grassroots (Greenfield) projects.
* Fluent in English language
* Demonstrates a broad technical knowledge of detailed design engineering codes and standards.
* Familiar with detailed engineering and design work procedures and processes.
* Able to read and understand contractual documentation.
* Able to effectively communicate with all stakeholders on a project.
* Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions.
* Works independently or with guidance in complex situations.
* Expected to lead functional team.
* Leads others to solve complex problems and uses sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions.
* Explains difficult concepts and negotiates with others to adopt a different point of view.
* Show flexibility and ensure proper hand-over with regards to:
	+ The replacement of colleagues during illness and holidays.
	+ The provision of assistance to other colleagues with heavy workloads (also other projects) when possible / desirable.
	+ The managing / learning of future current working methods and software applications.

#LI-FM1

title: Product Compliance Engineer - Industry Applications
description:
As a global technology leader with over 150 years of innovation, we are driving the development of premium solutions that optimize performance, safety and sustainability for the manufacturing industry. Atlas Copco Industrial Technique’s systems empower global industry users to control assembly processes.

**Your role**


The regulatory demands are increasing and our product portfolio is getting more advanced and modular, with focus on electronics and software-based products. Join us and take a key role in defining regulatory demands in our product development process and assisting R&D in obtaining and maintaining required certificates.


Your mission will be:

* Follow new and changed international legislations, directives and standards
* Create policies and transform the result into clear product requirements for different product families
* Provide guidance and support to projects though gate checks and assist in certification topics
* Facilitate risk assessments and support the internal risk management process
* Define product labeling and documentation requirements from a regulatory perspective
* Participate in internal and external inspections and audits
* Coordinate and oversee third-party testing and certification processes
* Maintain compliance documentation and records, including test reports, certificates and technical files


You will work in close collaboration with R&D and other company functions.

**City:** Nacka, Stockholm

**What you can expect from us**


At Atlas Copco we have a friendly atmosphere and a culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behavior and integrity. We offer plenty of opportunities to grow and develop, as well as potential to see your ideas realized and make an impact. You have plenty of occasions to international interaction and, as part of the Atlas Copco Group, you also have access to global job opportunities

**Your profile**

* Academic education in engineering (preferably electrical)
* Knowledge and experience in working with regulations, standards and certifications
* Hands on knowledge in applying regulations in EU, such as: Machinery Regulation, Battery Regulation, Radio Equipment Directive, etc.
* Familiarity with standards such as: IEC/EN 62133, IEC/EN 62841 and IEC/EN 61010
* Familiarity with testing methods and compliance procedures for electrical products
* Fluent in English (Swedish is optional)


For more information, please contact recruiting manager Aleksandra Duric, aleksandra.duric@atlascopco.com. We are looking forward to your application via our job site!


**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**  

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
company_description: Atlas Copco transforms industrial ideas into business value since 1873. Headquartered in Sweden, we serve 180+ countries. Learn more: www.atlascopcogroup.com

title: AI Integration Engineer
description:
Founded in 2018 and headquartered in The Netherlands, GT Ecom BV is on a mission to build the most efficient global direct-to-consumer infrastructure and become the world’s largest e-commerce company—powered by a collective of successful, scalable brands. By 2026, we’re aiming to achieve $500 million in revenue and operate over 50 thriving online stores worldwide.


With a team of 160+ top-tier remote e-commerce professionals across the globe, we blend local brand experiences with cross-border logistics, ensuring every customer feels connected—no matter where they are.


At our core, we value hard work, freedom with responsibility, constant improvement, and a mindset of positivity. We believe in building a high-performance, remote-first culture where honesty, excellence, and creativity drive everything we do—because the future of work is global, and we’re building it together.

 **The Upsides of Working with Us**


**Hard Work That Matters**


We’re surrounded by people who care deeply and give their best. We don’t settle for average—we show up, push boundaries, and aim high. That shared drive creates momentum and meaning in everything we do.


**Freedom with Responsibility**


You have the freedom to choose how, when, and where you work—but freedom only thrives when it’s paired with ownership. We trust you to manage your time, meet your commitments, and take responsibility for your impact.


**Constant Improvement**


Growth is part of our DNA. We believe in learning, evolving, and getting 1% better every day. Whether it’s a new skill, a fresh mindset, or sharper execution—stagnation isn’t in our vocabulary.


**Positivity by Default**


We approach people, problems, and communication with a positive mindset. That means giving the benefit of the doubt, staying constructive, and keeping energy high—even when challenges arise.


️ **Honesty & Transparency**


We believe the fastest way to move forward is through clear, honest communication. No politics. No guessing games. Just straight talk that builds trust and strengthens our team.


**Excellence Is the Baseline**


We hold ourselves and each other to a high standard—not out of pressure, but out of pride. We care too much about what we’re building to accept "good enough." Excellence is the expectation.


**Creativity Welcome Here**


We encourage bold ideas, fast testing, and open collaboration. Failure doesn’t scare us—comfort does. That’s why creativity is valued as a core ingredient in everything from product to process.

 **We’re looking for a sharp, social, empathic, and ambitious** **AI Integration Engineer** **to help build, integrate, and maintain advanced AI systems that power GTEcom's internal operations and customer-facing experiences.**

**The Challenge**


As an AI Integration Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain production-level AI solutions across core systems such as Customer Service Agents, ERP platforms, and Supply Chain tools. You’ll take ownership of key components within our AI infrastructure, ensuring scalability and high-quality code using Python, Langchain, and generative AI frameworks. Collaborating with product, operations, and engineering teams, you’ll help drive automation, contribute to our AI-first roadmap, and continuously evaluate emerging AI technologies for potential integration into GTEcom's ecosystem.

 **Early Success Milestones for this role**

* Independently take ownership of and deploy a key feature or component of the AI system (e.g., a module of the Customer Service AI Agent).
* Demonstrate initiative and autonomy in delivering a scalable AI solution that meets performance and quality standards.
* Actively contribute to team collaboration and code reviews, showcasing strong technical and interpersonal skills.

**Your Team When You Join Us**


You will collaborate closely with our full-stack development team and report directly to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO).


**We would love to hear from you if…**

* 3+ years of hands-on experience designing and deploying AI/ML solutions in a production environment.
* Strong experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) and generative AI application development.
* Proficiency in Python and Langchain.
* Solid understanding of software engineering principles and production-quality code deployment.
* Familiarity with OpenAI API, Ollama, Scikit-learn (SKlearn), or Huggingface ecosystem.
* Experience with integrating AI systems into ERP or supply chain tools.


**Couple of the notes about the role**  

* This is not a salaried position. This is an Independent Contractor role.
* You must be able to commit at least 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week.
* We require everybody in the team to use Hubstaff (https://hubstaff.com/) to track hours worked.

**Compensation**


We pay on an hourly basis — we’re open to reviewing rates based on experience and expertise. This role may have performance incentives.



If you are excited about the opportunity and feel like you are a good fit, we encourage you to apply today and talk to one of our recruiters. We look forward to seeing how your skills and experiences align with our vision.

**Note: Your portfolio is a strong requirement for the role. Your application will be tagged as rejected if you cannot provide your portfolio. Please avoid re-using your resume or putting your LinkedIn profile in the portfolio link.**

title: Senior Engineer R&D - Codes and Standards
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**


At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.


Currently we are looking for a Senior Engineer R&D specialised in codes and standards who will join our team in Luleå, Sweden. As a part of an R&D project team, the Senior Engineer Codes and Standards (C&S) leads the execution of C&S deliverables for new product development and for sustaining existing products through the products lifecycle. The C&S engineer provides expertise helping ensure the product designs are developed, maintained, and verified in compliance with the applicable codes and standards.

**What you'll be doing**

* Identify and document the standards that a product needs to meet based on understanding C&S and Regulatory implications of proposed design solution to meet compliance requirements of domestic and relevant foreign regulatory agencies.
* Document C&S plan for meeting compliance standards that are identified in the Design Requirement Specification including C&S verification.
* Lead the successful execution of the C&S plan for the product/projects.
* Provide documentation supporting applicable European Directive Compliance and technical file for CE marking.
* Document the certifications of the sites that will manufacture the product, including sub-contractors.
* Document the device and/or accessories compliance with the Essential Requirements defined in MDD Annex I or General Safety and Performance Requirements in MDR Annex I. Included within the Technical File.
* Lead interface for safety agency certificates & approval, documenting product certification by a third party review conducted by a recognized body.
* Lead interface for CB Report and Certificate, documenting product certification by a third party review conducted by a recognized body into a international report style.
* Lead EU Certification using appropriate MDD/MDR Annex path, documenting the product's compliance to the MDD 93/42/EEC or EUMDR 2017/745/EU for the European market. This is a third party review of the Technical File by a recognized body.
* Collaborate with cross functional teams, including engineering, quality, internal and external labs, and regulatory affairs, to ensure that products meet or exceed industry standards and regulations

**What you'll bring**

* BS or MS in an applicable engineering discipline with 3 or more years of experience in the design and implementation of complex systems.
* Experience in compliance engineering on complex design projects utilizing formal standards testing methodologies.
* Experience in Requirements and Risk Management, Configuration Management, Issue Management and Traceability.
* Good hardware interfacing background and system integration experience with microprocessor hardware and software.
* Experience in resolving complex technical problems in collaboration with design engineers.
* Demonstrated experience interfacing with certification bodies (UL, Intertek, CSA, etc.) and standards development organizations (IEC, ISO, NEMA, NFPA, ETSI, etc.).
* Demonstrated leadership competency working with diverse teams to solve complex problems.
* Demonstrated experience working with product standards and their global variants
* Knowledge of EMC regulations and certification procedures applicable to Electromechanical Devices sold worldwide including testing documentation, certification requirements and procedures (i.e. EN14971, EN60601, CISPR 11, FCC, EU etc.).
* Knowledge of lEC based safety standards, preferred: IEC/EN/UL 60601-1, lEC 60601-11, ISO10535, and EN 60601-2-52
* Able to work on multiple, competing priorities and resolve conflicts when necessary.
* Fluent English (Fluent Swedish is a plus)


Bachelor's Degree (±16 years) - Engineering, English, Identify and document the standards that a product needs to meet based on understanding C&S and Regulatory implications of proposed design solution to meet compliance requirements of domestic and relevant foreign regulatory agencies.  

Document C&S plan for meeting compliance standards that are identified in the Design Requirement Specification including C&S verification.  

Lead the successful execution of the C&S plan for the product/projects.  

Provide documentation supporting applicable European Directive Compliance and technical file for CE marking.  

Document the certifications of the sites that will manufacture the product, including sub-contractors.  

Document the device and/or accessories compliance with the Essential Requirements defined in MDD Annex I or General Safety and Performance Requirements in MDR Annex I. Included within the Technical File.  

Lead interface for safety agency certificates & approval, documenting product certification by a third party review conducted by a recognized body.  

Lead interface for CB Report and Certificate, documenting product certification by a third party review conducted by a recognized body into a international report style.  

Lead EU Certification using appropriate MDD/MDR Annex path, documenting the product's compliance to the MDD 93/42/EEC or EUMDR 2017/745/EU for the European market. This is a third party review of the Technical File by a recognized body.  

Collaborate with cross functional teams, including engineering, quality, internal and external labs, and regulatory affairs, to ensure that products meet or exceed industry standards and regulations.  

Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as regulatory authorities and industry associations, to stay current on changes and updates to industry codes and standards.  

Provide training and education to internal stakeholders on codes and standards issues.  

Support Audits as Codes and Standards Subject Matter Expert  

Other duties may be assigned.**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**  

  

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.
